title: Anyone can access deleted and private repository data on GitHub
dot: digraph CFOR_Vulnerabilities{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontsize=10];CFOR[label="Cross Fork Object Reference (CFOR) Vulnerability" shape=ellipse style=filled fillcolor=lightblue];Deleted_Forks[label="Accessing Deleted Fork Data" shape=box];Deleted_Repo[label="Accessing Deleted Repo Data" shape=box];Private_Repo[label="Accessing Private Repo Data" shape=box];Implications[label="Implications of CFOR Vulnerabilities" shape=box];CFOR->Deleted_Forks;CFOR->Deleted_Repo;CFOR->Private_Repo;Imp_1[label="1. title: You got a null result. Will anyone publish it?
dot:
digraph publication_bias{node[shape=box, style=filled, color=lightblue];"Natalie Pilakouta's Study"[label="Natalie Pilakouta's Study
- Inconclusive results
- Prefers cooler water"];"Publication Struggle"[label="Publication Struggle
- 7 journals, 6 years
- Published in 2023"];"File-drawer Problem"[label="File-drawer Problem
- Bias against null results
- Distorts scientific record"];"Replication Crisis"[label="Replication Crisis
- Failed reproductions
- Highlighted publication bias"];"Cultural Bias"[label="Cultural Bias
- 'Publish or perish' culture
- Bias towards positive results"];"Solutions"[label="Solutions
- Preregistration
- Registered reports"];"Positive Solutions"[label="Positive Solutions
- More registered reports
- Increased transparency"];"Natalie Pilakouta's Study"->"Publication Struggle";"Publication Struggle"->"File-drawer Problem";"File-drawer Problem"->"Replication Crisis";"Replication Crisis"->"Cultural Bias";"Cultural Bias"->"Solutions";"Solutions"->"Positive Solutions";}

title: AI models collapse when trained on recursively generated data
dot:
digraph G{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style="rounded,filled", fillcolor="#e3f2fd", fontcolor="#000000"];edge[color="#90caf9"]; Main[label="Main Idea: Model Collapse in LLM Training" shape=ellipse fillcolor="#bbdefb"]; ModelCollapse[label="What is Model Collapse?" fillcolor="#90caf9"];Definition[label="Definition: Degenerative process where
models forget true data distribution." fillcolor="#bbdefb"];Causes[label="Causes of Model Collapse:
1. Statistical Approximation Error
2. Functional Expressivity Error
3. Functional Approximation Error" fillcolor="#90caf9"]; Implications[label="Implications:
- Essential to maintain access to
original data distribution.
- Challenges in tracking LLM-generated data." fillcolor="#bbdefb"]; EarlyCollapse[label="Early Collapse:
Losing information about tails." fillcolor="#90caf9"];LateCollapse[label="Late Collapse:
Converges to a different distribution." fillcolor="#90caf9"]; Training[label="Training Process:
Model trained on data generated
from previous generations." fillcolor="#bbdefb"]; Main->ModelCollapse;ModelCollapse->Definition;ModelCollapse->Causes;Causes->EarlyCollapse;Causes->LateCollapse;Main->Implications;Implications->Training;}
